quest_title: The point having position vectors \(2i+3j+4k,\, \, \) \(3i+4j+2k,\) \(4i+2j+3k\) are the vertices of
explanation_txt:
Here,\(\overrightarrow{OA} =2i+3j+4k,\)

\(\overrightarrow{OB} =3i+4j+2k\)

\[\overrightarrow{OC} =4i+2j+3k\]

So, \(\overrightarrow{AB} =i+j-2k,\)

\(\overrightarrow{BC} =i-2j+k\),

\(\overrightarrow{CA} =2i-j-k\)

Clearly \(|AB|\, =\, |BC|\, =\, |CA|\, =\sqrt{6} \)

So these points are vertices of an equilateral triangle.

quest_title: A car accelerates from rest at constant rate of 2 m/s\({}^{2}\) for some times then it retards at a constant rate of 4 m/s\({}^{2}\) and comes to rest. the maximum speed attained by the car if it remaining motion of 3 seconds is
explanation_txt:
\(1^{\text {st }}\) Case
\(\mathrm{V}=2 \mathrm{t}_{1} \)

\(2^{\text {nd }}\) case
\(u=2 t_{1}, V=0 \)

\(\text { or, } 0=2 \mathrm{t}_{1}-4 \mathrm{t}_{2} \)
\(\text { or, } 2 \mathrm{t}_{1}=4 \mathrm{t}_{2} \)
\(\text { or, } \mathrm{t}_{2}=\cfrac{\mathrm{t}_{1}}{2} \)

Now,
\(\mathrm{t}_{1}+\mathrm{t}_{2}=3 \)

\(\text { or, } t_{1}+\cfrac{t_{1}}{2}=3 \)
\(\text { or, } 3 t_{1}=3 \times 2 \)
\(\text { or, } t_{1}=2 \text { sec } \)
\(\therefore \mathrm{V}_{\text {max }}=2 \times 2=4 \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s} \)

Or,

\(\begin{aligned} \mathrm{V}_{\max }=&\left(\cfrac{\mathrm{a}_{1} \mathrm{a}_{2}}{\mathrm{a}_{1}+\mathrm{a}_{2}}\right) \mathrm{t} \\ &=\left(\cfrac{2 \times 4}{2+4}\right) \times 3 \\ &=\cfrac{8}{6} \times 3 \\ &=4 \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s} \end{aligned}\)
question_plain_title: A car accelerates from rest at constant rate of 2 m/s for some times then it retards at a constant rate of 4 m/s and comes to rest. the maximum speed attained by the car if it remaining motion of 3 seconds is
explanation_plain_text:
Case

case



Now,




Or,

quest_title: A particle is executing SHM period T. The time taken by it to complete \(\cfrac{3}{8}\) oscillation starting from extreme position is
explanation_txt:
\(\cfrac{3}{8}\) oscillation \(=\left(\cfrac{1}{4}+\cfrac{1}{8}\right)\) oscillation
Time to complete \(\cfrac{1}{4}\) oscillation is

\(t_{1}=\cfrac{T}{4}\)
For \(\cfrac{1}{8}\) oscillation

\(\cfrac{\mathrm{r}}{2}=\mathrm{r} \sin \omega \mathrm{t}_{2}\)
or, \(\sin 30^{\circ}=\sin \omega \mathrm{t}_{2}\)
or, \(30 \times \cfrac{\pi}{180}=\cfrac{2 \pi}{\mathrm{T}} \mathrm{t}_{2}\)
or, \(\mathrm{t}_{2}=\cfrac{\mathrm{T}}{12}\)

\(\begin{aligned} \therefore \text { Total time } &=\mathrm{t}_{1}+\mathrm{t}_{2}=\cfrac{\mathrm{T}}{4}+\cfrac{\mathrm{T}}{12} \\ &=\cfrac{\mathrm{T}+3 \mathrm{T}}{12}=\cfrac{\mathrm{T}}{3} \end{aligned}\)

explanation_plain_text:
oscillation oscillation

quest_title: Water is flowing in a pipe of diameter 4 cm with a velocity 3 m/s. The water then enters into a tube of diameter 2 cm. The velocity of water in the other pipe is
explanation_txt: \(\begin{array} { l } { a _ { 1 } v _ { 1 } = a _ { 2 } v _ { 2 } \Rightarrow \cfrac { v _ { 2 } } { v _ { 1 } } = \cfrac { a _ { 1 } } { a _ { 2 } } = \left( \cfrac { r _ { 1 } } { r _ { 2 } } \right) ^ { 2 } } \\ { \Rightarrow v _ { 2 } = 3 \times ( 2 ) ^ { 2 } = 12 \mathrm { m } / \mathrm { s } } \end{array}\)

quest_title: In heat transfer, which method is based on gravitation
explanation_txt: Hot air has lower density than cold air as a result hot air rises upward and cold air moves downward. Greater the density of gas, greater is the pull of gravity. Therefore, natural convection is a consequence of gravity.
question_plain_title: In heat transfer, which method is based on gravitation
explanation_plain_text: Hot air has lower density than cold air as a result hot air rises upward and cold air moves downward. Greater the density of gas, greater is the pull of gravity. Therefore, natural convection is a consequence of gravity.

quest_title: The isotope \(_{19}^{40}K\) with a half life of 1.37\(\times\)10\({}^{9}\) yrs, decays to \(_{18}^{40} Ar \) which is stable moon rocks from the sea of tranquility. Show that the ratio of these potassium atom to argon atoms is 1/7. Estimate the age of rocks.
explanation_txt:
\(\cfrac{\mathrm{K}}{\mathrm{Ar}}=\cfrac{1}{7}\) means
\(\mathrm{K}=\mathrm{x}, \quad \mathrm{Ar}=7 \mathrm{x}\)
\(\mathrm{N}_{\mathrm{o}}=\mathrm{K}+\mathrm{Ar}=\mathrm{x}+7 \mathrm{x}=8 \mathrm{x}\)
\(\cfrac{\mathrm{N}}{\mathrm{N}_{\mathrm{o}}}=\left(\cfrac{1}{2}\right)^{\cfrac{t}{T_{1 / 2}}}\)
or, \(\cfrac{\mathrm{x}}{8 \mathrm{x}}=\left(\cfrac{1}{2}\right)^{\cfrac{t}{\mathrm{T}_{1 / 2}}}\)
or, \(\left(\cfrac{1}{2}\right)^{3}=\left(\cfrac{1}{2}\right)^{\cfrac{t}{T_{1 / 2}}}\)
\(\begin{aligned} \text { or, } \mathrm{t}=3 \mathrm{T}_{1 / 2} &=3 \times 1.37 \times 10^{9} \text { yrs. } \\ &=4.1 \times 10^{9} \mathrm{yrs} \end{aligned}\)
question_plain_title: The isotope with a half life of 1.3710 yrs, decays to which is stable moon rocks from the sea of tranquility. Show that the ratio of these potassium atom to argon atoms is 1/7. Estimate the age of rocks.
explanation_plain_text:
means



or,
or,
ans1_plain_text: 2.1110 yrs
ans2_plain_text: 4.1110 yrs
ans3_plain_text: 6.1110 yrs
ans4_plain_text: 8.1110 yrs

quest_title: Two metallic spheres of radii 1 cm and 2 cm are given charges 10\({}^{-2}\) C and 5 \(\times\) 10\({}^{-2}\) C respectively. If they are connected by a connecting wire, the final charge on the smaller sphere is
explanation_txt:
Common potential

\(V=\cfrac{\text { Total charge }}{\text { Total capacity }}\)

\(\therefore V=\cfrac{10^{-2}+5 \times 10^{-2}}{4 \pi \varepsilon_{0}\left(10^{-2}+2 \times 10^{-2}\right)}=\cfrac{2}{4 \pi \varepsilon_{0}}\)

\({\text { Final charge, on smaller sphere: }} \\ {q^{\prime}=C_{1} V=4 \pi \varepsilon_{0} \times 10^{-2} \times \cfrac{2}{4 \pi \varepsilon_{0}}=2 \times 10^{-2}}\)
question_plain_title: Two metallic spheres of radii 1 cm and 2 cm are given charges 10 C and 5 10 C respectively. If they are connected by a connecting wire, the final charge on the smaller sphere is
explanation_plain_text: Common potential
ans1_plain_text: 1 10 C
ans2_plain_text: 2 10 C
ans3_plain_text: 3 10 C
ans4_plain_text: 4 10 C

quest_title: A 2.5\(\mu\)F capacitor is connected in series with a non inductive resistor of 300\(\Omega\) across a source of Pd 50V and \(\cfrac {1000}{2\pi} \) Hz. The rate of energy supplied by source is
explanation_txt:
\(\begin{aligned} \mathrm{Z} &=\sqrt{\mathrm{R}^{2}+\mathrm{X} \mathrm{c}^{2}}=\sqrt{300^{2}+\left(\cfrac{1}{2 \pi \mathrm{fC}}\right)^{2}} \\ &=500 \Omega \\ \mathrm{I} &=\cfrac{\mathrm{V}}{\mathrm{Z}}=\cfrac{50}{500}=0.1 \mathrm{A} \end{aligned}\)

Energy \(=I^2 R=0.1^2\times 300 = 3\) watt

quest_title: Of the following species the one having a square planar structure is;
explanation_txt:
XeF4 has square planar though it has sp3d2 hybridization which causes having octahedral geometry but Xenon(Xe) has 2 large electrons as the lone pairs hence it is having square planar geometry.

All other compounds in the options have tetrahedral geometry, XeF4 is an exception.

quest_title: The ionization energy of hydrogen atom is 13.6 eV. The ionization energy of helium atom would be
explanation_txt: \(\begin{aligned} \mathrm{E} &=\mathrm{E}_{\infty}-\mathrm{E}_{1}=0+\mathrm{Z}^{2} \times 13.6 \\ &=2^{2} \times 13.6=54.4 \mathrm{eV} \end{aligned}\)

explanation_txt:

quest_title: Which of the following conditions represents an equilibrium ?
ans1_txt: Freezing of ice in a open vessel, temperature of ice is constant
ans2_txt: Few drops of water is present along with air in a balloon, temperature of balloon is constant
ans3_txt: Water is boiling in an open vessel over stove, temperature of water is constant
ans4_txt: All the statements (a), (b) and (c) are correct for the equilibrium
explanation_txt: Equilibrium can be achieved only in closed vessel.
question_plain_title: Which of the following conditions represents an equilibrium ?
explanation_plain_text: Equilibrium can be achieved only in closed vessel.
ans1_plain_text: Freezing of ice in a open vessel, temperature of ice is constant
ans2_plain_text: Few drops of water is present along with air in a balloon, temperature of balloon is constant
ans3_plain_text: Water is boiling in an open vessel over stove, temperature of water is constant
ans4_plain_text: All the statements (a), (b) and (c) are correct for the equilibrium

According to the Ostwald’s dilution formula .

\(\alpha ^ { 2 } = \cfrac { K ( 1 - \alpha ) } { C }\)

But for weak electrolytes \(\alpha\) is very small. So that \(1-\alpha\) can be neglected. So that .

quest_title: 0.45 \(\textit{g}\) of an acid (mol wt. = 90) required 20 \(\textit{ml}\) of 0.5 \(\textit{N \(KOH\) }\) for complete neutralization. Basicity of acid is
explanation_txt:
Normality = \(\textit{N}\) = \(\cfrac{W_{B} \; \times \; 1000}{Eq.\, wt\times V} \)

\[\therefore \; {\rm Eq.}\; {\rm Wt}\; =\; \cfrac{{\rm 0.45}\; \times \; {\rm 1000}}{0.5\; \times \; 20} \; =\; 45\]

\[\therefore \; {\rm Basicity}\; =\; \cfrac{{\rm Molec.}\; {\rm Wt}}{{\rm Eq.\; Wt}} \; =\; \cfrac{90}{45} \; =\; 2\]

therefore \(r=a+b.\)

quest_title: For Boyle's law to hold the gas should be
ans1_txt: Perfect and of constant mass and temperature
ans2_txt: Real and of constant mass and temperature
ans3_txt: Perfect and at constant temperature but variable mass
ans4_txt: Real and at constant temperature but variable mass
explanation_txt:
From Ideal gas equation,

\(PV=nRT\)

For, Boyle's law \(PV=\text{constant}\) to be true for gases, \(n\) and \(T\) should be constant

i.e. the gas should be ideal and should have constant mass and temperature.
question_plain_title: For Boyle's law to hold the gas should be
explanation_plain_text:
From Ideal gas equation,

For, Boyle's law to be true for gases, and should be constant

i.e. the gas should be ideal and should have constant mass and temperature.
ans1_plain_text: Perfect and of constant mass and temperature
ans2_plain_text: Real and of constant mass and temperature
ans3_plain_text: Perfect and at constant temperature but variable mass
ans4_plain_text: Real and at constant temperature but variable mass

quest_title: In a terrestrial telescope an erecting lens of focal length f is placed in between objective and eye lens then length of telescope increases by
explanation_txt: In terrestrial telescope the image of objective lies at 2f of erecting lens so the length of tube increases by 4f.

explanation_plain_text: In terrestrial telescope the image of objective lies at 2f of erecting lens so the length of tube increases by 4f.

quest_title: The wavelength of note emitted by fork of 480Hz at 27\({}^{o}\)C is 72cm. The density of air at STP is
explanation_txt:
\(v_{27}=\mathrm{f} \lambda=480 \times 0.72=345.6 \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}\)

And \(\cfrac{v_{0}}{v_{27}}=\sqrt{\cfrac{\mathrm{T}_{0}}{\mathrm{T}_{27}}}\)

\(v_{0}=345.6 \sqrt{\cfrac{273}{300}}=330 \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}\)

Here,

\(v_{0}=\sqrt{\cfrac{\gamma p_{0}}{\rho_{0}}}\)

\(\begin{aligned} \text { or, } \rho_{0} &=\cfrac{\gamma \mathrm{P}_{0}}{V_{\mathrm{o}}^{2}}=\cfrac{1.4 \times 1.01 \times 10^{5}}{330^{2}} \\ &=1.3 \mathrm{kg} / \mathrm{m}^{3} \end{aligned}\)

quest_title: A square loop of side 1 m is placed in a perpendicular magnetic field. Half of the area of the loop lies inside the magnetic field. A battery of emf 10 volt and negligible internal resistance is connected in the loop as shown in figure. The magnetic field changes with time according to the relation \(\text{B}\) = (0.01 -2\(\text{t}\)). The total emf of battery will be
explanation_txt:
\(E=-\cfrac{d \phi}{d t}=-\cfrac{d}{d t}(B A)=-A \cfrac{d B}{d t} \)
\(\therefore \quad B=0.01-2 t \)
\(\quad \cfrac{d B}{d t}=-2 \)
\(\text { From figure Area, } A=\cfrac{l^{2}}{2}=\cfrac{1^{2}}{2}=0.5 \)
\(E=-0.5 \times-2=1 \text { volt } \)
\(\text { Resultant (Total) emf }=10-1=9 \text { volt. } \)

quest_title: The solubility product of \(\text{xy\(_{2}\)}\) is 4 x \(10^{  - 9}\). Its solubility is
explanation_txt:
The solubility product of \(xy_2\) is \(4C^3\) where, \(C\) is solubility of \(xy_2\)

So, \(4 \times 10^{-9} = 4C^3\)

Hence, \(C = 10^{-3}\,\text{M}\)

quest_title: \(CuSO_4 \cdot 5H_2O\) is blue because:

quest_title: An aeroplane pilot wishes to fly north. A wind 80 km/hr is blowing towards west. If the speed of plane is 360 km/hr then the speed of plane in wind is
explanation_txt: \(\begin{array}{l}{\sin \alpha=\cfrac{\mathrm{V}_{\mathrm{w}}}{\mathrm{v}_{\mathrm{p}}}=\cfrac{80}{360}=\cfrac{2}{9}} \\ {\alpha=\sin ^{-1} \cfrac{2}{9}=12.84^{\circ}} \\ {\mathrm{v}_{\mathrm{R}}=\sqrt{v_{w}^{2}+2 v_{w} v_{p} \cos \left(90^{\circ}+\alpha\right)+v_{p}^{2}}=351 \mathrm{km} / \mathrm{hr}}\end{array}\)
